segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, and it makes me think of my own childhood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's so focused on that plate, just like my mom used to be.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water overflowing, and it reminds me of the times I made messes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are up to something, and it brings back memories.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy on the stool, reaching for cookies, and I remember doing the same thing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is waiting for a cookie, and it makes me smile.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water puddle getting bigger, and I feel a sense of urgency.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is still drying dishes, completely unaware of the chaos behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the children stay safe and get their cookies, just like I did.
segments.speaker: PAR
